qas.question: In regards to the mind, what are 3 theories that modern day philosophers try to harmonize?
What are 3 theories that ancient day philosophers try to harmonize?
What 3 theories do modern philosophers disagree with?
What are the three theories that do not accommodate mind?
Jerry Fodor disagrees with what framework?

context: Many current and recent philosophers—e.g., Daniel Dennett, Willard Van Orman Quine, Donald Davidson, and Jerry Fodor—operate within a broadly physicalist or <b4_0>materialist framework<b4_0/>, producing rival accounts of how best to accommodate mind, including <a0_0><b1_0><b2_0><b3_0>functionalism, anomalous monism, <b5_0>identity theory<b5_0/><b3_0/><b2_0/><b1_0/><a0_0/>, and so on.
